snippet: As the town buried the first young victims of the killings at an elementary school, investigators said it could take months to recreate a full account of the events.
abstract: Joint effort by Federal Bureau of Investigation and Conn State Police has been unsuccessful in recovering any data from a computer taken from the Newtown home of gunman Adam Lanza, who apparently deliberately destroyed the hard drive; investigators say they will examine computers, cellphones and game consoles in an effort to uncover a motive for Lanza's rampage, which left 27 dead.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Elizabeth Maker, J. David Goodman, Michael S. Schmidt, Randy Leonard and N. R. Kleinfield.

lead_paragraph: As the town buried the first young victims of the killings at an elementary school, investigators said it could take months to recreate a full account of the events.

headline.seo: Investigators Say Computer in Connecticut Gunman’s Home Yields No Data
headline.main: Computer in Connecticut Gunman’s Home Yields No Data, Investigators Say
headline.print_headline: Computer in Connecticut Gunman’s Home Yields No Data, Investigators Say
